isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER SERIES - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Block the right countershaft assembly against the case wall ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Block Right Countershaft Assembly Against Case Wall

step1.para: Lower the mainshaft assembly into position with 2nd gear next to 3rd gear ( Figure 156). Use a mainshaft hook if available to ease assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 156. Lower Mainshaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Lower pilot end of the mainshaft into position with the pocket bushing of the input shaft ( Figure 157).

figure.caption: Figure 157. Lower Pilot End of Mainshaft into Position

step1.para: Drive the input shaft assembly into the case ( Figure 158). Install gasket, bearing cover, and bolts, making sure the oil return holes are aligned (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Drive Input Shaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Move 2nd speed gear to the rear ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Move 2nd Speed Gear to Rear

note.para: Pick up on the mainshaft to aid in centering 2nd gear.

step1.para: Install the spacer into the 2nd speed gear, step to the rear ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Install Spacer into 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver to install the snap ring into 2nd speed gear ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Install Snap Ring into 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the large spacer on the mainshaft and against the rear of 2nd speed gear ( Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Install Spacer on Mainshaft

note.para: To center the rear of the mainshaft, place the two rear countershaft bearing retainer tabs between the bore in the case wall and 1st-2nd gear spacer ( Figure 163).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Place Retainer Tabs Between Bore in Case Wall and 1st-2nd Gear Spacer

step1.para: Temporarily install the rear countershaft into the main case countershaft to aid in centering the main case countershaft in the bearing bore ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Temporarily Install Rear Countershaft into Main Case Countershaft

step1.para: Check to make sure that the timing tooth on the left countershaft drive gear remained in mesh with the marked timing teeth of the main drive gear ( Figure 165).

figure.caption: Figure 165. Make Sure Timing Teeth Remain in Mesh

step1.para: Remove the blocking from the front of the right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Remove Blocking From Front of Right Countershaft Assembly

step1.para: Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. Mesh Marked Teeth

step1.para: Install the countershaft support tool in the front bearing bore ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Install Countershaft Support Tool

step1.para: Remove the rear countershaft ( Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Remove Rear Countershaft

step1.para: Install the rear and front countershaft bearings with a flanged bearing driver ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Install Rear and Front Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Remove the retainer tabs from under 1st and 2nd gear spacer and install them on the rear countershaft bearing. Lockwire securely ( Figure 171).

figure.caption: Figure 171. Install Retainer Tabs on Rear Countershaft Bearing

step1.para: Install 1st gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth of the gear to the rear ( Figure 172).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Install 1st Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Pick up on 1st gear and install spacer, step toward the front of the transmission ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Install Spacer

note.para: Make sure you install all mainshaft spacers and washers in the same position that was used previously in setting mainshaft tolerances.

step1.para: Install tolerance washer, flat side toward the spacer ( Figure 174). Rotate washer to align the splines with a screwdriver (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 174. Install Tolerance Washer and Rotate

step1.para: Install mainshaft key in the keyway of the mainshaft marked with "O" ( inset, Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Install Mainshaft Key in Keyway of Mainshaft Marked With "O"

step1.para: Install 1st-reverse clutch, shift fork and rail ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install 1st-Reverse Clutch, Shift Fork and Rail

note.para: Missing tooth in clutch must be aligned with key.

step1.para: Install 1st-reverse shift block and bolt ( Figure 177). Lockwire securely.

figure.caption: Figure 177. Install 1st-Reverse Shift Block and Bolt

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft key and install reverse gear tolerance washer, flat side to the rear of the transmission ( Figure 178). Re-install key (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Install Reverse Gear Tolerance Washer and Re-install Key

step1.para: Install spacer, stepped side to the rear of the transmission ( Figure 179).

figure.caption: Figure 179. Install Spacer

step1.para: Install reverse gear, clutching teeth toward the clutch ( Figure 180).

figure.caption: Figure 180. Install Reverse Gear

step1.para: Install chamfer spacer, flat side toward the reverse gear ( Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Install Chamfer Spacer
